title: How to Set a Feeding Pump

steps.headline: Wash your hands with antibacterial soap before handling the pump.
steps.description: Before you handle the food, pump, or feeding tube, wash your hands thoroughly with antibacterial soap. This will help keep the pump sanitized and ready for feeding.

steps.headline: Pour the formula into the feeding bag.
steps.description: Push down on the feeding bag cap and twist it until it comes off. Then, pour the appropriate amount of liquid food or formula into the feeding bag. Make sure that you only use the amount of formula determined by your doctor. Then, twist the cap back on tightly. Most feeding bags come in either small or large sizes. For larger feeding bags, add an extra 15 millilitres (0.063  c) for priming, which involves pushing a small amount of formula through the tube to get rid of excess air. For small feeding bags, add an extra 10 millilitres (0.042  c) for priming.

steps.headline: Hang the feeding bag 6 inches (15 cm) over the top of the pump.
steps.description: Once you’ve filled the feeding back, hang it on the IV stand 6 inches (15 cm) over top of the location where the pump is attached. If the bag is hung too high or too low, the pump feeding may be inaccurate. Most IV stands have a set of hooks at the top for the feeding bag and a hook in the middle where the feeding pump is attached. This setup can vary, however, so make sure you follow the instructions for your particular pump.

steps.headline: Prime the pump manually if you want to do it first.
steps.description: Infinity pumps provide you with the option to prime the pump manually to remove the air in the tubes before setting the pump. To do this, press the teardrop symbol on the blue section of the pump’s tubing. Then, squeeze the bag to get the formula to run through the tube and push out all the excess air. You can also wait and prime the Infinity pump after connecting the tubing to the pump.

steps.headline: Connect the tubing to the pump.
steps.description: Open the lid on the feeding set loading area on the pump. Loop the tubing ring around the black rotor, then press both the valves and their connector into the corresponding slots. Then, close the lid to the feeding set. With an Infinity pump, the two valves are attached together with a plastic connector with just enough tubing pulled through into a ring to go around the rotor. You’ll hear a “click” sound when the valves and the connector are pressed into place.

steps.headline: Press the button to prime the pump if you didn’t do it manually.
steps.description: First, press the power button to turn on the device. Then, press the “Prime Pump” button next to the screen. Hold the button down as the pump pushes formula through the tube, removing excess air out of the tubing. Once the tube is filled with formula, release the button to stop priming. If you’ve already primed the pump manually, you can skip this step.

steps.headline: Choose the rate at which you want the pump to dispense food.
steps.description: Push down on the “Rate/Dose” button once to bring the rate display up on the screen. Use the plus and minus symbols next to the screen to adjust the pump to dispense food at the appropriate rate. The rate determines how quickly your feeding pump will dispense food through the tube.

steps.headline: Determine the dosage you want the pump to dispense.
steps.description: First, press down on the “Rate/Dose” button again to change from the rate display to the dose display. Then, use the plus and minus symbols to set the correct dosage. The dosage determines how much food will be dispensed before the pump automatically stops feeding.

steps.headline: Run the pump to start feeding.
steps.description: First, connect the pump to the patient’s feeding tube by placing the end of the pump’s tubing into the patient’s feeding tube. Then, press the “Run” button on your Infinity pump to start dispensing food through the feeding tube. You can press “Pause” at any time to temporarily stop the pump from feeding.

steps.headline: Turn the pump on to get started.
steps.description: First, press down on the power button to turn on the device’s screen. Once the screen powers up, select whether you want to clear your previous settings by clicking “Clear Settings” or use your prior settings by selecting the “Prior Settings” button. Once you’ve chosen your settings, select “Load a set”. If you’ve never used the pump before, click “Clear Settings” to begin.

steps.headline: Place the tubing in the feeding set to connect it to the pump.
steps.description: Open the blue lid on the feeding set loading area on the pump. Click the top valve into its slot first, then wrap the tube around the black rotor. Finally, click the bottom valve into its slot. Close the lid to the feeding set once the valves are both clicked into place.

steps.headline: Prime the pump to remove any air remaining in the tube.
steps.description: Select the “Prime Pump” option on the screen. Then, choose the “Hold to Prime” button to hold down on the button manually until the formula has gone all the way through the tube, or select the “Auto Prime” option on the screen to fill the tube automatically. If you selected “Hold to Prime”, hold the button down as the pump pushes formula through the tube, removing excess air out of the tubing. Once the tube is filled with formula, release the button to stop priming. If you selected “Auto Prime”, the pump will start running formula through the tubes on its own.

steps.headline: Choose whether you want to run the continuous or intermittent mode.
steps.description: To choose whether you want your Kangaroo pump to feed continuously or dispense formula intermittently, select the “More” button on the pump screen. Then, select the “Continuous/Intermittent” option under the “More Options” menu. You can then choose the “Continuous Mode” option, or press the “Intermittent Mode” option. Click “Done” to return to the home screen.

steps.headline: Set the rate if you want the pump to feed continuously.
steps.description: If you’ve set your Kangaroo pump to feed continuously, select the “Adjust Feed” button on the screen. Then, select the “Feed Rate” option and press the arrows on the screen to adjust the feeding rate as needed. Press “Enter” to return to the previous screen. If you choose the intermittent feeding mode on your Kangaroo pump, skip this step.

steps.headline: Choose the dosage you want continuously dispensed.
steps.description: If you’re using the Kangaroo pump to continuously feed, press the “Feed VTBD” button. Use the arrows on the screen to set the dose, then press “Enter” to return to the home screen. The dosage determines how much food will be dispensed before the pump automatically stops feeding. Skip this step if you selected the “Intermittent Mode” on your Kangaroo pump.

steps.headline: Enter the bolus rate and volume if you’re feeding intermittently.
steps.description: If you selected the “Intermittent Mode” instead of the “Continuous Mode” on your Kangaroo device, begin by pressing the “Bolus Rate” option on the home screen. Use the arrows to set the time intervals at which the pump will dispense food. Then, press the “Number of Boluses” button and set how many intervals of food should be dispensed. Finally, press the “Volume Per Bolus” to set how much food will be dispensed at each given interval.

steps.headline: Start the pump to begin dispensing formula.
steps.description: First, connect the purple tip of the pump’s tubing to the patient’s feeding tube. Then, press the “Run” button on the screen to start dispensing food through the feeding tube. You can press “Hold” at any time to temporarily stop the pump from feeding. If you hold the feeding for more than 10 minutes, however, the device will sound an alarm.

text: Preparing the Feeding Bag Wash your hands with antibacterial soap before handling the pump. Before you handle the food, pump, or feeding tube, wash your hands thoroughly with antibacterial soap. This will help keep the pump sanitized and ready for feeding. Pour the formula into the feeding bag. Push down on the feeding bag cap and twist it until it comes off. Then, pour the appropriate amount of liquid food or formula into the feeding bag. Make sure that you only use the amount of formula determined by your doctor. Then, twist the cap back on tightly. Most feeding bags come in either small or large sizes. For larger feeding bags, add an extra 15 millilitres (0.063  c) for priming, which involves pushing a small amount of formula through the tube to get rid of excess air. For small feeding bags, add an extra 10 millilitres (0.042  c) for priming. Hang the feeding bag 6 inches (15 cm) over the top of the pump. Once you’ve filled the feeding back, hang it on the IV stand 6 inches (15 cm) over top of the location where the pump is attached. If the bag is hung too high or too low, the pump feeding may be inaccurate. Most IV stands have a set of hooks at the top for the feeding bag and a hook in the middle where the feeding pump is attached. This setup can vary, however, so make sure you follow the instructions for your particular pump. Setting an Infinity Pump Prime the pump manually if you want to do it first. Infinity pumps provide you with the option to prime the pump manually to remove the air in the tubes before setting the pump. To do this, press the teardrop symbol on the blue section of the pump’s tubing. Then, squeeze the bag to get the formula to run through the tube and push out all the excess air. You can also wait and prime the Infinity pump after connecting the tubing to the pump. Connect the tubing to the pump. Open the lid on the feeding set loading area on the pump. Loop the tubing ring around the black rotor, then press both the valves and their connector into the corresponding slots. Then, close the lid to the feeding set. With an Infinity pump, the two valves are attached together with a plastic connector with just enough tubing pulled through into a ring to go around the rotor. You’ll hear a “click” sound when the valves and the connector are pressed into place. Press the button to prime the pump if you didn’t do it manually. First, press the power button to turn on the device. Then, press the “Prime Pump” button next to the screen. Hold the button down as the pump pushes formula through the tube, removing excess air out of the tubing. Once the tube is filled with formula, release the button to stop priming. If you’ve already primed the pump manually, you can skip this step. Choose the rate at which you want the pump to dispense food. Push down on the “Rate/Dose” button once to bring the rate display up on the screen. Use the plus and minus symbols next to the screen to adjust the pump to dispense food at the appropriate rate. The rate determines how quickly your feeding pump will dispense food through the tube. Determine the dosage you want the pump to dispense. First, press down on the “Rate/Dose” button again to change from the rate display to the dose display. Then, use the plus and minus symbols to set the correct dosage. The dosage determines how much food will be dispensed before the pump automatically stops feeding. Run the pump to start feeding. First, connect the pump to the patient’s feeding tube by placing the end of the pump’s tubing into the patient’s feeding tube. Then, press the “Run” button on your Infinity pump to start dispensing food through the feeding tube. You can press “Pause” at any time to temporarily stop the pump from feeding. Setting a Kangaroo Joey Pump Turn the pump on to get started. First, press down on the power button to turn on the device’s screen. Once the screen powers up, select whether you want to clear your previous settings by clicking “Clear Settings” or use your prior settings by selecting the “Prior Settings” button. Once you’ve chosen your settings, select “Load a set”. If you’ve never used the pump before, click “Clear Settings” to begin. Place the tubing in the feeding set to connect it to the pump. Open the blue lid on the feeding set loading area on the pump. Click the top valve into its slot first, then wrap the tube around the black rotor. Finally, click the bottom valve into its slot. Close the lid to the feeding set once the valves are both clicked into place. Prime the pump to remove any air remaining in the tube. Select the “Prime Pump” option on the screen. Then, choose the “Hold to Prime” button to hold down on the button manually until the formula has gone all the way through the tube, or select the “Auto Prime” option on the screen to fill the tube automatically. If you selected “Hold to Prime”, hold the button down as the pump pushes formula through the tube, removing excess air out of the tubing. Once the tube is filled with formula, release the button to stop priming. If you selected “Auto Prime”, the pump will start running formula through the tubes on its own. Choose whether you want to run the continuous or intermittent mode. To choose whether you want your Kangaroo pump to feed continuously or dispense formula intermittently, select the “More” button on the pump screen. Then, select the “Continuous/Intermittent” option under the “More Options” menu. You can then choose the “Continuous Mode” option, or press the “Intermittent Mode” option. Click “Done” to return to the home screen. Set the rate if you want the pump to feed continuously. If you’ve set your Kangaroo pump to feed continuously, select the “Adjust Feed” button on the screen. Then, select the “Feed Rate” option and press the arrows on the screen to adjust the feeding rate as needed. Press “Enter” to return to the previous screen. If you choose the intermittent feeding mode on your Kangaroo pump, skip this step. Choose the dosage you want continuously dispensed. If you’re using the Kangaroo pump to continuously feed, press the “Feed VTBD” button. Use the arrows on the screen to set the dose, then press “Enter” to return to the home screen. The dosage determines how much food will be dispensed before the pump automatically stops feeding. Skip this step if you selected the “Intermittent Mode” on your Kangaroo pump. Enter the bolus rate and volume if you’re feeding intermittently. If you selected the “Intermittent Mode” instead of the “Continuous Mode” on your Kangaroo device, begin by pressing the “Bolus Rate” option on the home screen. Use the arrows to set the time intervals at which the pump will dispense food. Then, press the “Number of Boluses” button and set how many intervals of food should be dispensed. Finally, press the “Volume Per Bolus” to set how much food will be dispensed at each given interval. Start the pump to begin dispensing formula. First, connect the purple tip of the pump’s tubing to the patient’s feeding tube. Then, press the “Run” button on the screen to start dispensing food through the feeding tube. You can press “Hold” at any time to temporarily stop the pump from feeding. If you hold the feeding for more than 10 minutes, however, the device will sound an alarm.
